comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: A photo in the Bismarck daily tribune., August 10, 1916, Image 1 shows him standing in front of the same type of plane, obviously a Curtiss JN-4 "Jenny" (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Curtiss_JN-4). According to the text, he was lieutenant of the British Royal Aviation corps at that time (and spended his time at night giving dancing lessons to officers).

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: On February 19, 1916, it was reported that British Army Captain Archibald B. Ford, 22, was training pilots for Curtiss and that he had been training Vernon Castle, who intended to enlist. It could be Capt. Ford on the left, though this person doesn't look a lot like Ford in this earlier Bain photo: select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F50A1EFC345C1373...
